events.originalText: The United States military ended its "don't ask, don't tell" policy, consequently allowing gay and lesbian people to serve openly.
events.subtitle: Don't ask, don't tell
events.headline: US military ends 'don't ask, don't tell' policy

events.originalText: An explosive-laden truck detonated in front of the Marriott hotel in Islamabad, Pakistan, killing 54 people and injuring 266 others.
events.subtitle: Islamabad Marriott Hotel bombing
events.headline: Explosive-laden truck detonates at Marriott hotel in Islamabad, Pakistan

events.originalText: The Real Irish Republican Army carried out a rocket-launcher attack on the MI6 headquarters in London, with no casualties and minimal damage recorded.
events.subtitle: Real Irish Republican Army
events.headline: Real Irish Republican Army attacks MI6 headquarters in London

events.originalText: Hurricane Erika, the strongest and longest-lasting hurricane of the 1997 Atlantic hurricane season, dissipated after causing flooding and power outages throughout Puerto Rico.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Erika (1997)
events.headline: Hurricane Erika causes flooding and power outages in Puerto Rico

events.originalText: British prime minister Margaret Thatcher gave a landmark speech at the Belfry of Bruges, Belgium, against federalism in the European Economic Community.
events.subtitle: Margaret Thatcher
events.headline: Margaret Thatcher speaks against federalism in European Economic Community

events.originalText: The Cosby Show, which became one of three U.S. television shows to have the highest ratings five years in a row, premiered with its pilot episode.
events.subtitle: The Cosby Show
events.headline: The Cosby Show premieres with high ratings

events.originalText: A series of celestial phenomena of disputed nature was observed in the western Soviet Union, Finland and Denmark.
events.subtitle: Petrozavodsk phenomenon
events.headline: Celestial phenomena observed in western Soviet Union, Finland, and Denmark

events.originalText: Billie Jean King defeated Bobby Riggs in straight sets at the Astrodome in Houston, Texas, in an internationally televised tennis match dubbed the "Battle of the Sexes".
events.subtitle: Billie Jean King
events.headline: Billie Jean King defeats Bobby Riggs in 'Battle of the Sexes'

events.originalText: Hurricane Irene (satellite image pictured) moved into the Pacific Ocean from the Atlantic, making it the first actively tracked tropical cyclone to do so.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Irene–Olivia
events.headline: Hurricane Irene moves from Atlantic to Pacific Ocean

events.originalText: Sweden, Norway, and Denmark submit the Greek case alleging human rights violations by the Greek junta.
events.subtitle: Greek case
events.headline: Sweden, Norway, and Denmark submit Greek human rights case

events.originalText: L. Ron Hubbard, the founder of Scientology, announced the story of Xenu in a taped lecture sent to all Scientologists.
events.subtitle: L. Ron Hubbard
events.headline: L. Ron Hubbard announces story of Xenu to Scientologists

events.originalText: Second World War: Allied forces captured San Marino from the German Army.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied forces capture San Marino from German Army

events.originalText: World War II: Australian troops led by Gordon Grimsley King defeated Imperial Japanese forces at the Battle of Kaiapit in New Guinea.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Australian troops defeat Imperial Japanese forces at Battle of Kaiapit

events.originalText: Irish War of Independence: British auxiliary police officers known as Black and Tans went on a rampage in Balbriggan, burning more than fifty homes and businesses and killing two people.
events.subtitle: Irish War of Independence
events.headline: Black and Tans rampage in Balbriggan during Irish War of Independence

events.originalText: The Bersaglieri entered Rome through the Porta Pia, ending the temporal power of the Pope and completing the unification of Italy.
events.subtitle: Bersaglieri
events.headline: Bersaglieri enter Rome, ending temporal power of the Pope

events.originalText: The French Army achieved its first major victory of the War of the First Coalition at the Battle of Valmy.
events.subtitle: French Army
events.headline: French Army wins Battle of Valmy in War of the First Coalition

events.originalText: The first of a series of treaties comprising the Peace of Ryswick was signed between France and the Grand Alliance, ending the Nine Years' War.
events.subtitle: Peace of Ryswick
events.headline: Peace of Ryswick signed, ending Nine Years' War

events.originalText: First English Civil War: The First Battle of Newbury was fought in Berkshire; Parliamentarian forces were allowed to pass Royalist troops to retreat the next morning.
events.subtitle: First English Civil War
events.headline: First Battle of Newbury fought in Berkshire during First English Civil War

events.originalText: A tsunami caused by the Meiō earthquake washed away the building housing the statue of the Great Buddha (pictured) at Kōtoku-in in Kamakura, Japan; the statue has since stood in the open air.
events.subtitle: Tsunami
events.headline: Tsunami washes away building housing Great Buddha statue in Kamakura, Japan

events.originalText: The second of two major uprisings by the Old Prussians, a Baltic tribe, began against the Teutonic Knights.
events.subtitle: Prussian uprisings
events.headline: Second major uprising by Old Prussians begins against Teutonic Knights

events.originalText: Harald III of Norway and his English ally Tostig Godwinson defeated the northern earls Edwin and Morcar at the Battle of Fulford near York.
events.subtitle: Harald Hardrada
events.headline: Harald III of Norway and Tostig Godwinson defeat northern earls at Battle of Fulford
